symptoms.name: Focal neurologic deficits
symptoms.pattern: Present in 29% of cases (e.g., cranial nerve abnormalities)

physical_findings: Focal neurologic deficits (e.g., cranial nerve abnormalities)
risk_factors: Delayed or inadequate treatment of another clinical form of plague (e.g., bubonic plague)
Axillary or cervical buboes (potentially greater risk than inguinal buboes)

required: Presence of meningitis in a patient with plague (nuchal rigidity or at least 2 other clinical signs/symptoms of meningitis: altered mental status, headache, seizures, or focal neurologic signs)
Laboratory evidence of meningitis in a patient with plague (Yersinia pestis in CSF by culture, PCR, or Gram stain)
